command.name: account_tx
command.desc: Get a list of transactions that affected this account.

argument.name: account
argument.desc: The account ID to fetch transactions from.

argument.name: ledger_min
argument.desc: The earliest ledger to fetch transactions from.

argument.name: ledger_max
argument.desc: The latest ledger to fetch transactions from. Set to -1 to use the current ledger as the maximum.

argument.name: binary
argument.desc: Returns the transaction in hex instead of JSON.

argument.name: forward
argument.desc: Returns the transactions in ascending order by ledger.

argument.name: limit
argument.desc: Limit the number of transactions stellard will send back to you. stellard is configured with its own limits so you may not receive as many transactions as you ask for. Set to -1 to use the limit set by stellard.

command.name: book_offers
command.desc: Returns the offers in a given orderbook. An orderbook is a particular currency/issuer on the buy side and a different currency/issuer on the sell side.

argument.name: taker_gets
argument.desc: The amount for the buy side. A value should not be specified in this amount object, as the buy side of an orderbook is simply a currency/issuer pair.

argument.name: taker_pays
argument.desc: The amount for the sell side. A value should not be specified in this amount object, as the sell side of an orderbook is simply a currency/issuer pair.

argument.name: taker
argument.desc: If specified will show the orderbook from the point of view of the taker.

argument.name: marker
argument.desc: Token indicating start of page, it is returned from a previous call.

result.name: hash
result.desc: The hash of the submitted transaction.

result.name: marker
result.desc: Used for subsequent calls to page through the results. Not returned if there are no more results.

result.name: offers
result.desc: The offers sorted from best to worst.

command.name: ledger
command.desc: Gets info about a particular ledger.

argument.name: full
argument.desc: Return all the ledger entries. This is equivalent to setting accounts, transactions, and expand all to true. stellard can be configured to support this or not.

argument.name: accounts
argument.desc: If set to true, it will return the accounts tree for that public ledger block.

argument.name: transactions
argument.desc: If true, return the transactions for the ledger.

argument.name: expand
argument.desc: If set to true, returns the ledger and transaction entries in JSON format. Otherwise, returns their identifying hashes.

command.name: find_path
command.desc: Finds the best path for a transfer. Stellard will continue to send updates as it finds better paths or as the state of the ledger changes until find_path is called again with the close subcommand. A websocket connection may only have one open pathfinding request. If stellard responds because of a client query the response will have a field type set to response. If stellard is sending an unsolicited response the type field will be set to find_path. This command is only available via the Websocket API. If you want to use as RPC or command line or you don't want ongoing path updates use static_path_find instead.

argument.name: subcommand
argument.desc:
subcommand can be either
  • create
  • status
  • close

argument.name: source_account
argument.desc: Sender's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_account
argument.desc: Receiver's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_amount
argument.desc: Amount sender is trying to send to receiver.

result.name: alternatives
result.desc: Each entry will correspond to one possible source currency.

command.name: static_path_find
command.desc: Finds a path for a transfer. If you want updates to the path as the state of the ledger changes use find_path instead.

argument.name: source_account
argument.desc: Sender's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_account
argument.desc: Receiver's Stellar address.

argument.name: destination_amount
argument.desc: Amount sender is trying to send to receiver.

result.name: source_amount
result.desc: The cost of this path for the source account.

result.name: paths_computed
result.desc: The path to include in the payment transaction.

result.name: destination_currencies
result.desc: List of currencies this destination can hold.

command.name: subscribe
command.desc:
Listen to events. If you are using websocket stellard will send you messages when an event of the type you are listening to happens. You can also specify a URL that is called when an event happens if you are not listening on websocket.

See unsubscribe for when you want to stop the event stream.

argument.name: streams
argument.desc:
An array of stream names you want events on. Possible streams:
  • ledger - ledger close events
  • transactions - sends a message for every transaction that makes it into a closed ledger.
  • transactions_rt - sends a message immediately when a this stellard sees a transaction and again when the transaction makes it into the ledger.
  • server - sends messages about server status and network connectivity.

argument.name: accounts
argument.desc: An array of accountIDs you want events on. Will subscribe you to transaction streams for the given accounts.

argument.name: accounts_rt
argument.desc: An array of accountIDs you want events on. Sends a message immediately when stellard sees a transaction effecting one of these accounts and again if the transaction is included in the ledger.

argument.name: books
argument.desc:
An array of objects specifying an order books to listen to. Stellard will send a message any time one of the specified order books change. Order book object is:
  • taker_gets- type of currency and issuer the taker of these offers will get.
  • taker_pays- type of currency and issuer the taker of these offers will pay.
  • both- if set to true will send you events for both sides of the order book.
  • snapshot- if set to true will send you the current state of the order book before it starts streaming the changes.
Example: { "taker_gets" : { "currency": "USD", "issuer" : address }, "taker_pays" : { "currency": "BTC", "issuer" : address }, "snapshot" : "true" , "both" : "true" }

argument.name: url
argument.desc: Specifies a URL that stellard will post messages to via JSON-RPC when your specified events happen. This parameter is required if you're using the JSON-RPC endpoint. Each message will come with a sequentially increasing sequence number starting with 1. A gap in these numbers indicates a lost message. Currently, only http is supported and hosts must be specified by IP address.

argument.name: url_username
argument.desc: Optional username for JSON-RPC authentication.

argument.name: url_password
argument.desc: Optional password for JSON-RPC authentication.

result.name: Stream type 'server'
result.desc:
A Returned message from a subscribe of the "server" stream".
  • type - "serverStatus"
  • load_base - the minimum/normal load factor (256)
  • load_factor - This value reflects the load the stellard node is under.
  • server_status/li>
  • random - a random value generated for this event

result.name: Stream type 'ledger'
result.desc:
A Returned message from a subscribe of the "server" stream". Issued once the ledger is validated, for each ledger close.
  • type - "ledgerClosed"
  • txn_count - number of transactions that will be published in this ledger.
  • reserve_base - minimum reserve balance for an account to be created with.
  • reserve_inc - For each "entry" that corresponds to your account (eg. offers or trust lines), your minimum reserver increments by this amount
  • fee_base - The "base" fee is the cost to send a reference transaction under no load, expressed in millionths of one STR.
  • fee_ref - The units used to scale the fee base.

result.name: Stream type 'transactions'
result.desc:
A Returned message from a subscribe of the "server" stream".
  • type - "transaction"
  • transaction - Transaction information
  • meta - Includes "AffectedNodes" for this transaction.

command.name: tx
command.desc: Get details of a specific transaction.

argument.name: transaction
argument.desc: Index (hash) of the transaction to fetch.

argument.name: binary
argument.desc: If true, will return the binary representation of this transaction.

command.name: tx_history
command.desc: Returns the last N transactions starting from the given index. Returns from latest to earliest. N is set by stellard.

argument.name: startIndex
argument.desc: Index to start returning transactions from.

command.name: unsubscribe
command.desc: Unsubscribe from events that were previously subscribed to. See subscribe for a list of possible events. To unsubscribe from events previously subscribed to just specify them in the same way.
